abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Third
            Additional Financing of the Partnership for Polio
            Eradication Project is to assist, as part of a global polio
            eradication effort, the Government of Nigeria to achieve its
            goal of interrupting the transmission of wild polio virus,
            and to sustain these efforts throughout the implementation
            of the project, through effective Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV)
            coverage of the target population. The additional credit
            will help finance the procurement of additional OPV in
            support of Nigeria's final efforts to eradicate
            poliomyelitis. While Nigeria has seen more than a 98 percent
            in reduction of Polio cases and OPV coverage is more than 80
            percent, the fact that new Polio cases have been detected
            require that immunizations need to be carried out longer
            than originally anticipated. The additional financing will
            assist the Government of Nigeria in maintaining the
            effective OPV coverage of the target population, of critical
            importance for interrupting Polio transmission and finally
            eradication. The additional credit will help finance the
            procurement of additional OPV, and this scaling up and
            intensification of activities will maximize the project
            impact and development effectiveness. The additional
            financing also supports activities that are central to
            achieving the health related millennium development goals.
            International Development Association's (IDA's)
            support for the project is fully embedded in the national
            program for polio eradication and contributes to the
            national strategy for improving routine immunization.
